intro: [WRONG START] Arenaria bryoides var. guatemalaensis, commonly known as the Guatemalan sandspurry, is a perennial flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers with five petals, typically blooming in spring and early summer. Its leaves are linear and covered in fine hairs, adapted to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil.
